description: A very popular Poicephalus species. They have a charcoal grey head, green back and throat, and a distinctive V-shaped patch of yellow, orange, or red on their belly.
temperament: Playful, comical, and can be very cuddly. They often bond very strongly with one person and can become jealous or nippy towards others if not well-socialized.
loudness: Quiet to Moderate. They are not prone to screaming but have a variety of loud whistles and squawks.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-green-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Quiet"><title>Quiet</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Can develop a fair vocabulary of words and phrases. Their voice is often high-pitched and childlike. They are great mimics of sounds.
dietaryNeeds: A pelleted diet, supplemented with fresh vegetables and limited fruits. They are prone to Vitamin A deficiency, so provide plenty of dark leafy greens and orange vegetables.
healthPointers: Generally a very hardy and healthy bird with a lifespan of 20-30 years. Can be prone to polyomavirus. Require lots of toys to keep them from becoming bored.
housing: An excellent apartment bird. A minimum cage size of 24"W x 20"D x 24"H is recommended.
